TopicTitle: LLL - Lack Luster Labs - Development Thread

Articles.Content:
i believe its offset to minimize the obstruction of the cargo bay from the docking module. It is also thinner and keeps the shuttle at a slight distance to make docking safer.

And it looks nifty. Yes, nifty.

It's offset because the wider side is meant to mate with Unity/Station and is therefore a berthing mechanism. It's also offset as to provide necessary clearance with the Space Shuttle's cockpit.
Awesome! Thanks. Was hoping for 5 man though this is a good start!

Hey Lack, can you comment on this? Not sure if FAR issue or what.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/20451-0-23-Ferram-Aerospace-Research-v0-12-5-2-Aero-Fixes-For-Planes-Rockets-1-7-14?p=1014979&viewfull=1#post1014979

Lack, any chance we could get a version of the "XC-MTV Structural Super Structure" that has one or multiple sides clear of truss work (could be 4 sides with with only the vertical bits joining the end rings) to allow Copernicus MTV style construction?

Would be nice if: http://i.imgur.com/pSzVV6O.jpg or similar worked

I've also been learning about KW and B9; and LLL seems to have them beat on the Ram usage front.

Well, LLL has a lot of 1024*1024 textures -for some of the parts, the resolution is justified, but for other, simpler parts, it is unnecessary and could just as well use a lower texture size. B9 uses a ton of memory simply because there are so many parts (although almost all of them have *1024 textures), and the memory load of B9 can be massively reduced by installing the low res texture pack - it isn't actually that low-res, it still looks quite good. KW has a very good texture reduction pack that only reduces the emmissive and normal maps, which means that it's very hard to spot a difference, yet it still quarters the memory usage of KW. Anyway, I can only recommend installing some mods, it gives you a lot of new choices when it comes to style.

Another idea: the landing air-bags animation could probably be linked to a landing gear suspension function like stock landing gear to deflate a bit on impact, or a whole lot if you make the "suspension" soft.

@SSSP,

Yeah. I've seen that before. I think the last time ferram reckoned it was due to the sudden change in shape and circumference. There's nothing dodgy with the model itself, it's as simple as simple can be. You could try changing altering the size of the nodes (7th number in the node_stack), it not being definied might be part of it. Like so.

node_stack_top = x, y, z, xdir, ydir, zdir, 1

node_stack_top = x, y, z, xdir, ydir, zdir, 2

Not too bothered by a 5 man pod at the moment, it'd only mean making a new IVA and they're dreary things to make. I'll likely reconsider at some point.

@BananaD,

I'll consider it.

@drtedastro,

Yeah, BahamutoD has some pretty great stuff. I'm especially loving the new animation module. I also found out that MM can handle switches based on if a mod is installed. That provides a nice by-pass to my problems with plugin animations (namely having the replace the stock one).

@K3|,

Yeah, sure.

@K3| part 2,

I tried that. The suspension modules are really tempremental, so I've never been able to tell if it'll work or not. In the past just switching meshes has messed up with it, even with the same hierachy. It didn't work this time.

@wasmic,

Texture reduction packs are essentially redundent now with Active Texture Management, you'll see no real gains with both installed vs just ATM.

@BananaD,

I'll consider it.

Thanks, but let's keep it either just Banana, Ban or the full thing... "BananaD" sounds... Dirty...

Thanks, but let's keep it either just Banana, Ban or the full thing... "BananaD" sounds... Dirty...

@Lack - Thanks, I edited the file as follows:

node_stack_top = 0, 1.27142936, 0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1

node_stack_bottom = 0, -1.27142936, 0, 0.0, -1.0, 0.0, 2

(Hope this is right, never edited a part before).

It may be the width change, changing the above numbers perhaps made a slight improvement, but it's still saying drag is about 75kN vs cockpit at 0.2kN....

I think I will wait for next FAR release. Cheers.
Make sure to install the auto tracking / unable to turn off functions......
